custom_domain.description: Custom Domain to use for the website. Shall contain only letters, numbers and -, and can look like example.com, first2.example.com special-site.example.com.
custom_domain.title: Custom Domain

type.description: Type of slave. If redirect, the slave will redirect to the given URL. If zope, the rewrite rules will be compatible with Virtual Host Monster. All frontends support websocket by default and under the hood, but switch to type:websocket allow to configure websocket-path-list and websocket-transparent options.
type.title: Backend Type

path.description: Path to proxy to in the backend
path.title: type:zope Backend Path

enable_cache.description: If set to true, http caching server (Apache Traffic Server) will be used between frontend and backend
enable_cache.title: Enable Cache

https-only.description: If set to true, http requests will be redirected to https
https-only.title: HTTPS Only

default-path.description: Provide default path to redirect user to when user access / (the site root)
default-path.title: type:zope Default Path

disable-no-cache-request.description: If set to true, Cache-Control and Pragma requests headers will not be sent to cache and backend servers. This prevents clients from bypassing cache when enable_cache is true
disable-no-cache-request.title: enable_cache: Disable 'no-cache' requests

disable-via-header.description: If set to true, Via response headers will not be sent to client
disable-via-header.title: enable_cache: Disable 'Via' headers from cache

disabled-cookie-list.description: List of Cookies separated by space that will not be sent to cache and backend servers. This is especially useful to discard analytics tracking cookies when using Vary: Cookie cache headers
disabled-cookie-list.title: Disabled Cookies

enable-http2.description: Use HTTP2 Protocol for the site
enable-http2.title: Enable HTTP2 Protocol

enable-http3.description: Use HTTP3 Protocol for the site. It requires enable-http2 to be set. The end results depends on the cluster configuration.
enable-http3.title: Enable HTTP3 Protocol

https-url.description: HTTPS URL of the backend if it is different from url parameter
https-url.title: HTTPS Backend URL

websocket-path-list.description: Space separated list of path to the websocket application. If not set the whole slave will be websocket, if set then / will be HTTP, and /<websocket-path> will be WSS. In order to have ' ' in the space use '%20'
websocket-path-list.title: type:websocket Websocket Application Path List

websocket-transparent.description: If set to false, websocket slave will be without passing X-Real-Ip, X-Forwarded-Proto and X-Forwarded-Port. Depending on the application the setting shall be false or true. Defaults to true for transparent proxying.
websocket-transparent.title: type:websocket Transparent proxy

prefer-gzip-encoding-to-backend.description: If set to true, frontend will rewrite Accept-Encoding request header to simply 'gzip' for all variants of Accept-Encoding containing 'gzip', in order to maximize cache hits for resources cached with Vary: Accept-Encoding when enable_cache is used
prefer-gzip-encoding-to-backend.title: Prefer gzip Encoding for Backend

server-alias.description: Server Alias List separated by space
server-alias.title: Server Alias

ssl-proxy-verify.description: If set to true, Backend SSL Certificates will be checked and frontend will refuse to proxy if certificate is invalid
ssl-proxy-verify.title: Verify Backend Certificates

ssl_crt.description: Content of the SSL Certificate file. Deprecated, please use key-upload-url.
ssl_crt.title: [DEPRECATED] SSL Certificate

ssl_key.description: Content of the SSL Key file. Deprecated, please use key-upload-url.
ssl_key.title: [DEPRECATED] SSL Key

ssl_ca_crt.description: Content of the CA certificate file. Deprecated, please use key-upload-url.
ssl_ca_crt.title: [DEPRECATED] SSL Certificate Authority's Certificate

ssl_proxy_ca_crt.description: Content of the SSL Certificate Authority file of the backend (to be used with ssl-proxy-verify)
ssl_proxy_ca_crt.title: SSL Backend Authority's Certificate

virtualhostroot-http-port.description: Port where http requests to frontend will be redirected.
virtualhostroot-http-port.title: type:zope virtualhostroot-http-port

virtualhostroot-https-port.description: Port where https requests to frontend will be redirected.
virtualhostroot-https-port.title: type:zope virtualhostroot-https-port

backend-connect-timeout.description: Time in seconds for establishing connection to the backend.
backend-connect-timeout.title: Timeout for backend connection (seconds)

backend-connect-retries.description: Amount of retries to connect to the backend. The amount of backend-connect-timeout*backend-connect-retries seconds will be spent to connect to the backend.
backend-connect-retries.title: Amount of retries to connect to the backend.

ciphers.title: Ordered space separated list of ciphers
ciphers.default: ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305 ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA AES256-SHA AES128-SHA ECDHE-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA DES-CBC3-SHA

authenticate-to-backend.description: If set to true the frontend certificate will be used as authentication certificate to the backend. Note: backend might have to know the frontend CA, available with 'backend-client-caucase-url'.
authenticate-to-backend.title: Authenticate to backend

health-check.title: Health Check
health-check.description: Enables active checks of the backend. For HTTP level checks the HTTP code shall be 2xx or 3xx, otherwise backend will be considered down.

health-check-http-method.title: Health Check HTTP Metod
health-check-http-method.description: Selects method to do the active check. CONNECT means that connection will be enough for the check, otherwise it's HTTP method.

health-check-http-path.title: Health Check HTTP Path
health-check-http-path.description: A path on which do the active check, unused in case of CONNECT.

health-check-http-version.title: Health Check HTTP Version
health-check-http-version.description: A HTTP version to use to check the backend, unused in case of CONNECT.

health-check-timeout.title: Health Check Timeout (seconds)
health-check-timeout.description: A timeout to for the request to be fulfilled, after connection happen.

health-check-rise.title: Health Check Rise
health-check-rise.description: Amount of correct responses from the backend to consider it up.

health-check-fall.title: Health Check Fall
health-check-fall.description: Amount of bad responses from the backend to consider it down.

health-check-failover-https-url.description: HTTPS URL of the failover backend if it is different from health-check-failover-url parameter. Note: It requires https-url to be configured, as otherwise the differentiation does not make sense..
health-check-failover-https-url.title: Failover HTTPS Backend URL

health-check-authenticate-to-failover-ba.description: If set to true the frontend certificate will be used as authentication certificate to the failover backend. Note: failover backend might have to know the frontend CA, available with 'backend-client-caucase-url'.
health-check-authenticate-to-failover-ba.title: Authenticate to failover backend

health-check-failover-ssl-proxy-verify.description: If set to true, failover backend SSL Certificates will be checked and frontend will refuse to proxy if certificate is invalid
health-check-failover-ssl-proxy-verify.title: Verify failover backend certificates

health-check-failover-ssl-proxy-ca-crt.description: Content of the SSL Certificate Authority file of the failover backend (to be used with health-check-failover-ssl-proxy-verify)
health-check-failover-ssl-proxy-ca-crt.title: SSL failover backend Authority's Certificate

strict-transport-security.title: Strict Transport Security
strict-transport-security.description: Enables Strict Transport Security (HSTS) on the slave, the default 0 results with option disabled. Setting the value enables HSTS and sets the value of max-age. More information: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Strict-Transport-Security

strict-transport-security-sub-domains.title: Strict Transport Security Sub Domains
strict-transport-security-sub-domains.description: Configures Strict Transport Security for sub domains.

strict-transport-security-preload.title: Strict Transport Security Preload
strict-transport-security-preload.description: Configures Strict Transport Security preload mechanism.

url-netloc-list.title: [EXPERT] List of netlocs for "Backend URL"
url-netloc-list.description: Space separated list of netlocs (ip and port) of backend to connect to. They will share the scheme and path of the original URL and additional backend parameters (like "SSL Backend Authority's Certificate"). Each of them will be used, and at least one is enough for the connectivity to work, and the best results are with "Health Check" feature enabled. Port is mandatory, so hostnames shall be provided as hostname:port (eg. example.com:80), IPv4 - as ipv4:port (eg. 127.0.0.1:80), IPv6 - as ipv6:port (eg. ::1:80). Simply this parameters only overrides netloc (network location) of the original URL.

https-url-netloc-list.title: [EXPERT] List of netlocs for "HTTPS Backend URL"
https-url-netloc-list.description: See "[EXPERT] List of netlocs for "Backend URL"" description.

health-check-failover-url-netloc-list.title: [EXPERT] List of netlocs for "Failover backend URL"
health-check-failover-url-netloc-list.description: See "[EXPERT] List of netlocs for "Backend URL"" description.

health-check-failover-https-url-netloc-l.title: [EXPERT] List of netlocs for "Failover HTTPS Backend URL"
health-check-failover-https-url-netloc-l.description: See "[EXPERT] List of netlocs for "Backend URL"" description.
